de.tschebbischeff.model

Class ModelSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tschebbischeff.model.ModelSettings

  • public class ModelSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static settings for the model.
    Since:
    2017-07-08
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Roboscope

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double distanceScale
      Change this factor to the scale you are using for distance. 1.0 means that any distance value you supply to the model is in meters. 1000.0 means that any distance value you supply to the model is in kilometers.
      static double massScale
      Change this factor to the scale you are using for mass. 1.0 means that any mass value you supply to the model is in earth masses, which equals 5.972 * 10^24 kg.
      static double timeScale
      Change this factor to the scale you are using for time. 1.0 means that any time value you supply to the model is in seconds. 60.0 means that any time value you supply to the model is in minutes.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModelSettings()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • distanceScale

        public static double distanceScale
        Change this factor to the scale you are using for distance. 1.0 means that any distance value you supply to the model is in meters. 1000.0 means that any distance value you supply to the model is in kilometers. Generally speaking 1.0 of your value corresponds to distanceScale meters.

      • massScale

        public static double massScale
        Change this factor to the scale you are using for mass. 1.0 means that any mass value you supply to the model is in earth masses, which equals 5.972 * 10^24 kg. Generally speaking 1.0 of your value corresponds to massScale earth masses, it may be most useful to supply the mass of your host star in earth masses as the scale.

      • timeScale

        public static double timeScale
        Change this factor to the scale you are using for time. 1.0 means that any time value you supply to the model is in seconds. 60.0 means that any time value you supply to the model is in minutes. Generally speaking 1.0 of your value corresponds to timeScale seconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelSettings

        public ModelSettings()
